channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Retract or Not: A Tale of Two Fans
item.description: arXiv:2507.22162v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $X$ be a Lelek fan or a Cantor fan and let $Y$ be a Lelek fan or a Cantor fan. In this paper, we study embeddings $ f: X \to Y $ that admit retractions from $ Y $ onto $ f(X)$. In 1989, W. J. Charatonik and J. J. Charatonik proved that if $X$ is a Lelek fan and $Y$ is a Cantor fan, then no embedding $f$ of $X$ into $Y$ admits a retraction from $Y$ onto $f(X)$. They also showed that if both $X$ and $Y$ are Cantor fans, then every embedding $f$ of $X$ into $Y$ admits such a retraction. In this paper, we address the two remaining cases. First, we consider the situation where $X$ is a Cantor fan and $Y$ is a Lelek fan. We prove that in this case, every embedding $f$ of $X$ into $Y$ admits a retraction from $Y$ onto $f(X)$. Second, we examine the case where both $X$ and $Y$ are Lelek fans. Here, we show that there exist embeddings $f$ that do admit a retraction from $Y$ onto $f(X)$, as well as embeddings that do not. For this latter case, we also identify additional properties of embeddings that ensure the existence of a retraction from $Y$ onto $f(X)$.
item.dc:creator: Iztok Banic, Goran Erceg, Sina Greenwood, Judy Kennedy

item.title: No covering with nowhere dense \textsf{P}-sets in the Cohen model
item.description: arXiv:2507.22476v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove that if less than $\aleph_{\omega}$-many Cohen reals are added to a model of \textsf{CH}, then $\omega^{\ast}$ can not be covered by nowhere dense \textsf{P}-sets (equivalently, there is an ultrafilter on $\omega$ that does not contain a tower).
item.dc:creator: Alan Dow, Osvaldo Guzm\'an
